{"step_by_step_thinking": "The description of a large, necrotic tumor on the left kidney with histological examination showing primitive blastemal cells and immature tubules and glomeruli suggests a diagnosis of Wilms tumor, also known as nephroblastoma. Wilms tumor arises from the embryonic structure called the metanephros, which is the precursor to the kidney. Therefore, the tissue derived from the same embryological structure as Wilms tumor is the kidney.", "answer_choice": "D"}
